detail_description: Piazza Maggiore is the main square in the heart of Bologna, Italy. It is surrounded by some of the city's most important buildings and has been a central gathering place for locals and visitors for centuries. The square is lined with cafes, restaurants, and shops, making it a lively hub of activity. Visitors can admire the beautiful architecture, including the Basilica of San Petronio and the Palazzo d'Accursio.
name: Piazza Maggiore

excerpt: Vast Gothic basilica with an unfinished brick & marble facade, housing 22 art-filled side chapels.
detail_description: Basilica di San Petronio is a grand Gothic basilica in Bologna, dedicated to the city's patron saint, Petronius. The 14th-century edifice boasts an unfinished brick and marble facade and houses 22 art-filled side chapels. It stands as one of Italy's most monumental Gothic basilicas, with a capacity for up to 28,000 people.
name: Basilica di San Petronio

excerpt: Museum featuring Italian art from the 13th century to the 1700s, including the Renaissance.
detail_description: The Pinacoteca Nazionale di Bologna is a museum showcasing Italian art from the 13th century to the 1700s, with a focus on Renaissance works. Situated in close proximity to several significant cultural and educational institutions, including the Science Institute and the Academy of Fine Arts, this museum features 30 halls for permanent exhibitions as well as spaces for temporary displays, workshops, and conferences.
name: Pinacoteca Nazionale di Bologna
address: Via delle Belle Arti, 56, 40126 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Hilltop, baroque-style Roman Catholic sanctuary church, dedicated to the Virgin Mary, with a cupola.
detail_description: Santuario Madonna di San Luca is a stunning hilltop Roman Catholic sanctuary church in Bologna, Italy. The baroque-style church is dedicated to the Virgin Mary and features a beautiful cupola. Visitors can embark on a scenic CAI trail that starts in Bologna and follows the arcades of San Luca, offering breathtaking views as it passes through Casalecchio and ends in Sasso Marconi at the Ponte di Vizzano.
name: Santuario Madonna di San Luca
address: Via di San Luca, 36, 40135 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Lively indoor market with stalls supplying local produce, meats & cheeses, plus dining options.
detail_description: Mercato delle Erbe is the largest indoor market in Bologna, offering a wide array of fresh local produce, meats, cheeses, and other specialties. In addition to being a bustling marketplace, it has also become a popular dining destination with various food stalls and eateries serving traditional Italian dishes as well as international cuisine.
name: Mercato delle Erbe
address: Via Ugo Bassi, 25, 40121 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Bologna is the lively, historic capital of the Emilia-Romagna region, in northern Italy. Its Piazza Maggiore is a sprawling plaza lined with arched colonnades, cafes and medieval and Renaissance structures such as City Hall, the Fountain of Neptune and the Basilica di San Petronio. Among the cityâ€™s many medieval towers are the Two Towers, leaning Asinelli and Garisenda.
detail_description: Bologna, the vibrant capital of the Emilia-Romagna region in northern Italy, is a city steeped in history and charm. Its Piazza Maggiore boasts stunning medieval and Renaissance architecture, including the iconic Two Towers. The city's elegant arcades create a romantic atmosphere as they wind through the pedestrianized center, where you'll find an array of fine dining establishments and lively bars. Bologna offers a range of accommodations, from converted palazzos to chic contemporary hotels.
name: Bologna

excerpt: Prominent historic basilica with a Romanesque facade, many paintings & Saint Dominic's remains.
detail_description: The Basilica of San Domenico in Bologna is a significant historic site with a Romanesque facade and houses the remains of Saint Dominic, the founder of the Dominican order. The church features an array of remarkable artworks by renowned artists such as Guercino, Filippino Lippi, and Ludovico Carracci.
name: Basilica of San Domenico
address: P.za S. Domenico, 13, 40124 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Spurting mermaids surrounding a vast 16th-century fountain topped with the bronze figure of Neptune.
detail_description: Neptune's Fountain, also known as the Fountain of Neptune (Fontana del Nettuno), is a stunning 16th-century fountain located in Bologna. This magnificent work of art was created by Giambologna and commissioned to glorify the papal government of Pope Pius IV. The fountain stands in the center of Piazza del Nettuno and features a bronze statue of Neptune atop a pedestal, surrounded by spurting mermaids and four heraldic dolphins representing rivers from different continents.
name: Neptune's Fountain
address: Piazza del Nettuno, 40124 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Lively covered food market with pasta, meat & cheese, pizza & drinks, plus table seating.
detail_description: Mercato di Mezzo is a vibrant covered food market located in the heart of Bologna's Quadrilatero. Recently renovated and reopened, this historic market spans 700 square meters across three levels. It offers a variety of local specialties such as fresh pasta, salumi, cheeses, piadine, tigelle, wines from the Enoteca Regionale Emilia-Romagna, craft beer, gourmet sandwiches, and sweets.
name: Mercato di Mezzo

excerpt: Art museum with permanent collection from 1945 to the present, plus temporary contemporary shows.
detail_description: MAMbo - Museo d'Arte Moderna di Bologna, also known as Bologna's Museum of Modern Art, is a vibrant cultural institution that opened in 2007. Housed in the former Forno del Pane, it offers a comprehensive exploration of Italian art from the post-World War II era to the present day. The museum actively engages with contemporary art through temporary exhibitions and innovative artistic practices.
name: MAMbo - Museo d'Arte Moderna di Bologna
address: Via Don Giovanni Minzoni, 14, 40121 Bologna BO, Italy

detail_description: Quadrilatero, also known as Bologna's immortal quarter, is a historic area filled with stories of art, love, and trade. The streets have witnessed centuries of human interactions and are home to the Albergo delle Drapperie, where people from around the world have met and shared their experiences.
name: Quadrilatero
address: Bologna, Metropolitan City of Bologna, Italy

excerpt: Cluster of chapels, crypts & vaults built over centuries, displaying remains of medieval frescoes.
detail_description: The Basilica Santuario Santo Stefano, also known as the Complesso delle Sette Chiese or Seven Churches, is a remarkable cluster of chapels, crypts, and vaults that were built over several centuries. This complex includes the Church of the Crucifix, the Basilica del Sepolcro, the Church of San Vitale, and Sant'Agricola among others.
name: Basilica Santuario Santo Stefano - Complesso delle Sette Chiese
address: Via Santo Stefano, 24, 40125 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Popular public park with lots of trees, a lake & lawns, plus a jogging path & play areas for kids.
detail_description: Giardini Margherita is Bologna's largest and most popular park, attracting locals and tourists alike. As the sun sets, it becomes a favorite spot to unwind and enjoy the transformation of the sky. The park features a jogging path, play areas for kids, a lake, and plenty of trees and lawns. It offers a serene atmosphere for visitors to relax with blankets, wine, and nibbles while soaking up the warm evening ambiance.
name: Giardini Margherita
address: Viale Giovanni Gozzadini, 40136 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Food-centric theme park featuring eateries, pop-stores, demonstrations & hands-on exhibits.
detail_description: FICO World Eataly, located just outside Bologna, is a massive 25-acre food-centric theme park and educational center. It's often referred to as the 'Disneyworld of Food' and offers visitors a unique experience focused on Italian food heritage and production. The complex features 45 trattorias, starred-restaurants, street food kiosks, on-site factories, a large marketplace, and two hectares of farmland with over 200 animals.
name: FICO World Eataly
address: Via Paolo Canali, 8, 40127 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Small plaza adjacent to the Piazza Maggiore known for its iconic, 16th-century Fountain of Neptune.
detail_description: Piazza del Nettuno is a small plaza located next to the Piazza Maggiore in Bologna. It is famous for being home to the iconic Fountain of Neptune, which features a striking bronze statue of Neptune created by the Flemish sculptor Giambologna in 1564. The fountain quickly became controversial due to its nudity and the erotic nature of the female figures spouting water from their breasts.
name: Piazza del Nettuno

excerpt: Snug, busy counter-serve doling out classic pizza by the slice or pie, plus calzones & sandwiches.
detail_description: Pizzeria Due Torri is a bustling counter-serve spot offering traditional pizza by the slice or whole, along with calzones and sandwiches. It's located in Bologna, where the iconic Two Towers, Asinelli and Garisenda, stand tall as symbols of the city's medieval past. These towers were built in the 12th century by noble families to showcase their wealth and influence. Visitors can climb the Asinelli Tower for a breathtaking panoramic view of Bologna.
name: Pizzeria Due Torri

detail_description: IQOS PARTNER - Tabaccheria La Piazzola is a historic market located in the Piazza dell Agosto in Bologna. With over 400 stalls, it offers a wide variety of items for sale, including clothes, shoes, fashion accessories, flowers, pottery and jewelry. It has been popular with both locals and tourists for many years.
name: IQOS RESELLER - Tabaccheria La Piazzola, Bologna

excerpt: Library & anatomical theater in a 16th-century building with frescoes & an array of coats of arms.
detail_description: Biblioteca Comunale dell'Archiginnasio is a historic building in Bologna that served as the first seat of the University of Bologna. The Anatomical Theatre inside the Archiginnasio provides insight into the early scientific studies of the human body, featuring anatomical models and statues of renowned physicians. The Palazzo dell'Archiginnasio, now housing the municipal library, was constructed in record time to provide a unified space for various academic disciplines.
name: Biblioteca Comunale dell'Archiginnasio

excerpt: Elaborate Gothic-style Catholic church with a large dome & many historic murals & sculptures.
detail_description: Santuario di Santa Maria della Vita, also known as the Church of Holy Mary of Life, is a stunning Gothic-style Catholic church located just east of the lively Main Square ('Piazza Maggiore'). The interior boasts bold 17th-century High Baroque frescoes and historic murals and sculptures.
name: Santuario di Santa Maria della Vita

excerpt: 16th-century palazzo at the University of Bologna, with eclectic science exhibits & frescoes.
detail_description: Museo di Palazzo Poggi is a 16th-century palazzo located at the University of Bologna, housing an eclectic collection of science exhibits and adorned with stunning frescoes by renowned painters. Originally established as the Institute of Sciences and Arts in 1711, it now showcases rich collections dedicated to various subjects such as geography, navigation, military architecture, physics, natural history, chemistry, human anatomy, and obstetrics.
name: Museo di Palazzo Poggi

excerpt: Catholic church restored in the 17th & 18th centuries, with a tall bell tower & frescoes.
detail_description: Cattedrale Metropolitana di San Pietro, also known as the Duomo di San Pietro, is a Catholic church in Bologna dedicated to the city's patron saint, Petronius. The church was restored in the 17th and 18th centuries and features a tall bell tower and frescoes.
name: Cattedrale Metropolitana di San Pietro

excerpt: Egyptian, Roman & Etruscan artifacts fill this archaeological museum housed in a 1400s palazzo.
detail_description: The Museo Civico Archeologico is a treasure trove of ancient artifacts from Egyptian, Roman, and Etruscan civilizations. Housed in a 15th-century palazzo that was once the ominously named 'Hospital of Death,' the museum boasts a vast collection that dates back to the 1500s.
name: Museo Civico Archeologico

detail_description: Piazza Santo Stefano is named after the Church of Santo Stefano, which covers the entire eastern side of this triangular area. It's not just one church, but a complex of religious buildings that has earned the square its other name, the piazza of Seven Churches.
name: Piazza Santo Stefano

detail_description: Located in Bologna, Torre Prendiparte, also known as Torre Coronata, is the city's second-tallest tower at over 59 meters high. Built in the 12th century by the powerful Guelph Prendiparte family during a turbulent civil war, it served as a fortress for the family. The tower was also used to imprison those who committed religious crimes in the 18th century.
name: Torre Prendiparte (Sky Experience)

excerpt: 16th-century hall used for anatomy lectures & dissections, with intricate wood sculptures.
detail_description: Teatro Anatomico is a 16th-century hall that was used for anatomy lectures and dissections, featuring intricate wood sculptures. While witnessing surgeries or autopsies in the past might have been gruesome, the theater's contributions to medical science are significant. Visitors can learn about the university's background and the theater itself from staff and tour guides. The well-preserved museum offers a glimpse into the human body's study, making it a must-see for all town visitors.
name: Archiginnasio Palace and Anatomical Theater

excerpt: 13th-century palace with a grand interior, host to large-scale events with high-tech equipment.
detail_description: Palazzo Re Enzo is a 13th-century palace located in the heart of Bologna, Italy. It is a grand and historic building that hosts large-scale events equipped with modern technology. The palace is situated in the Piazza, surrounded by significant public buildings and cultural landmarks such as Palazzo d'Accursio, Palazzo del Podesta, Basilica di San Petronio, Fontana del Nettuno, Palazzo dei Notai, and Palazzo de Banchi.
name: Palazzo Re Enzo
address: Piazza del Nettuno, 1/C, 40125 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Art gallery with exhibitions & talks exploring the interface between photography & technology.
detail_description: MAST is an international cultural institution that focuses on art, technology, and innovation. It aims to support the development of creativity and entrepreneurship in new generations through collaborations with other institutions. The foundation hosts Foto/Industria, the world's only biennial dedicated to photography related to industry and work. MAST features exhibitions exploring the intersection of photography and technology, offering talks and events for visitors interested in art, technology, and creativity.
name: MAST

excerpt: History & culture of Bologna explored through relics & multimedia exhibits in a palace museum.
detail_description: Palazzo Pepoli - Museo della Storia di Bologna is a captivating museum housed in the grand Palazzo Pepoli, offering an immersive journey through the history and culture of Bologna. The museum, which opened in 2012, features interactive exhibits that bring to life the city's 2500-year history. Visitors can explore 35 themed rooms showcasing ancient relics and multimedia presentations.
name: Palazzo Pepoli - Museo della Storia di Bologna

detail_description: Santo Stefano is a delightful neighborhood located in the heart of Bologna, offering an ideal setting for an unforgettable vacation. It caters to both seasoned travelers and first-time visitors, providing accommodation within walking distance of major attractions while maintaining a peaceful atmosphere away from the city center's hustle and bustle.
name: Santo Stefano
address: 40125 Bologna, Metropolitan City of Bologna, Italy

excerpt: Museum with recovered airplane parts & objects from an unsolved crash that occurred in 1980.
detail_description: The Museum for the Memory of Ustica is a historical museum that houses recovered airplane parts and objects from an unsolved crash that occurred in 1980. The exhibit provides a solemn tribute to the victims of the tragedy, where visitors can enter a room below ground level to see the wreckage of the plane. The display serves as a reminder of our human capacity for memory and how it shapes who we are. In addition, Christian Boltanski's installation adds personal depth to the dismantled aircraft.
name: Museo per la Memoria di Ustica
address: Via di Saliceto, 3/22, 40128 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: City's main square lined with Medieval & Renaissance buildings, lines with cafes & street musicians.
detail_description: Piazza Maggiore, the main square in Bologna's historical center, is a bustling hub of activity. It serves as the perfect starting point for exploring the city, featuring notable landmarks such as the grand San Petronio cathedral, the iconic Neptune fountain, and the Palazzo d'Accursio museum housed within the city hall building.
name: Piazza Maggiore

excerpt: Town hall complex dating from the 14th century, home to a fresco-filled chapel & fine art museum.
detail_description: Palazzo d'Accursio is a historic town hall complex in Bologna, dating back to the 14th century. It is situated in the city center, surrounded by important public buildings and cultural landmarks such as Palazzo Re Enzo, Palazzo del Podesta, Basilica di San Petronio, Fontana del Nettuno, Palazzo dei Notai, and Palazzo de Banchi. The complex also includes a chapel adorned with frescoes and a fine art museum.
name: Palazzo d'Accursio

excerpt: Renaissance palace & art gallery with renowned 17th century frescoes & high-profile exhibitions.
detail_description: Palazzo Fava is a Renaissance palace and art gallery in Bologna, Italy. It is renowned for its 17th-century frescoes and hosts high-profile exhibitions. The palace offers a rich cultural experience with pathways filled with artifacts and exhibits from the Middle Ages, spanning from the 5th to the 15th century. Visitors can admire beautiful paintings and artworks by famous painters while exploring the museum.
name: Palazzo Fava

excerpt: Once a government building, this 14th-century palace offers an art collection & self-guided tours.
detail_description: Palazzo d'Accursio, also known as Palazzo Comunale, served as the Town Hall for Bologna until 2008. Situated in Piazza Maggiore near the Fountain of Neptune, this 14th-century palace houses the Civic Art Collection featuring Renaissance masterpieces and the Museo di Giorgio Morandi with acclaimed still-life artworks.
name: Palazzo d'Accursio (Palazzo Comunale)

detail_description: Portico di S. Luca is a must-visit in Bologna, known as the longest portico in the world. The 3.7 km UNESCO heritage site offers a wonderful walk with shops, restaurants, and stalls along the way. The path leads to the sanctuary of Madonna di San Luca on Guard Hill, providing a beautiful and impressive experience for visitors.
name: Portico di S. Luca

excerpt: Airport named for local engineer & Nobel laureate Guglielmo Marconi, with buses to the city centre.
detail_description: Bologna Guglielmo Marconi Airport, named after the local engineer and Nobel laureate, is conveniently located just 4 miles from the center of Bologna. It offers direct flights to various European cities as well as internal flights within Italy. The airport has excellent transport connections, with a bus departing for Bologna every 11 minutes.
name: Bologna Guglielmo Marconi Airport
address: Via del Triumvirato, 84, 40132 Bologna BO, Italy

detail_description: Mercato Ritrovato is a vibrant market held in the courtyard of Cinema Lumiere in Bologna. It features local farmers, winemakers, and brewers offering seasonal products from within a 25-mile radius of the city. The stalls adhere to the Slow Food movement principles, showcasing the origin and production methods of their goods. This market reflects Bologna's dedication to sustainability and local agriculture, with an emphasis on organic and locally sourced items such as traditional balsamic vinegar and regional wines.
name: Mercato Ritrovato
address: Via Azzo Gardino, 65, 40122 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Burial ground on a medieval monastery site with 1300s & 1800s buildings, statues & monumental tombs.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Bologna, Certosa di Bologna is a captivating monumental cemetery that serves as both a burial ground and an open-air museum. Established in 1801 on the grounds of a former Carthusian monastery, this historic site spans an impressive 30 hectares and showcases stunning architecture from the 1300s to the 1800s.
name: Certosa di Bologna
address: Via della Certosa, 18, 40122 Bologna BO, Italy

detail_description: Strolling along the historic Via Drapperie, one of the oldest streets in the city, I couldn't help but notice a captivating sign that piqued my interest.
name: Via Drapperie

excerpt: Landmark symbols of the city built by noble families in the 12th century, offering city views.
detail_description: The Two Towers, also known as Due Torri, are iconic landmarks in Bologna, Italy. These medieval leaning towers were built in the 12th and 13th centuries by noble families and have become symbols of the city. The taller of the two, Torre degli Asinelli (Asinelli Tower), stands at 97 meters with 498 steps offering panoramic views of Bologna.
name: Two Towers
address: P.za di Porta Ravegnana, 40126 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Ornate, 16th-century palace with frescoes, housing music museum with instrument & book collections.
detail_description: The International Museum and Library of Music is housed in an ornate 16th-century palace adorned with frescoes. It features a remarkable collection of musical instruments and books. The museum offers visitors a unique experience, paying homage to the memory of Aerolinee Itavia flight 870, which tragically crashed over Sicily in 1980. The museum provides a comprehensive overview of the tragedy and its societal impact, serving as a place for contemplation, reflection, and seeking truth.
name: Museo internazionale e biblioteca della musica

excerpt: Emilia-Romagna is a region in northern Italy, extending from the Apennine Mountains to the Po River in the north. It's known for its medieval cities, rich gastronomy and seaside resorts. The capital, Bologna, is a vibrant city with an 11th-century university and arched porticos lining the streets and squares of its medieval core. Ravenna, near the Adriatic coast, is famed for its brightly colored Byzantine mosaics.
detail_description: Emilia-Romagna, a region in northern Italy, boasts medieval cities, a rich gastronomic scene, and seaside resorts. Bologna, the capital city, is known for its vibrant atmosphere and historic university. Ravenna is famous for its colorful Byzantine mosaics near the Adriatic coast. Sestola, also called The Pearl of the Apennines, is a prominent ski resort due to its proximity to Mount Cimone.
name: Emilia-Romagna

excerpt: City library in an elegant, airy & storied space, with ancient ruins visible beneath the floor.
detail_description: Nestled within the historic Municipal Palace, Biblioteca Salaborsa is a stunning blend of past and present. This elegant library, once the city's Stock Exchange, has been transformed into a vibrant multimedia hub that invites visitors to explore its rich cultural offerings. The airy space features a striking Art Nouveau design and boasts an intriguing glass panel in its floor that reveals ancient ruins beneathâ€”remnants of medieval houses, Renaissance walls, and Roman foundations.
name: Biblioteca Salaborsa
address: Piazza del Nettuno, 3, 40124 Bologna BO, Italy

excerpt: Short historic street with cafes & shops, running from Piazza Maggiore to the city's iconic towers.
detail_description: Via Rizzoli is a historic street in Bologna, Italy, known for its charming cafes and shops. It has a rich history dating back over two millennia when it was originally named Via Aemilia. This segment of the Roman 'decumanus maximus' connects Piazza Maggiore to the iconic Two Towers of Bologna. The street emerged from the former Middle Market area and is now named after Francesco Rizzoli, a renowned orthopedist.
name: Via Rizzoli

excerpt: Scenic 19th-century park with an ornate staircase & the remains of a 14th-century castle.
detail_description: Parco della Montagnola is a 19th-century park located in Bologna, Italy. It features an ornate staircase and the remains of a 14th-century castle, offering visitors a glimpse into the city's rich history. Situated near the historic center, it provides a peaceful retreat from the bustling streets and modern attractions. The park has served various purposes over the years, including as a venue for performances and sports competitions.
name: Parco della Montagnola

excerpt: University of Bologna's lush botanical garden featuring greenhouses & around 5,000 plants.
detail_description: The Botanical Garden and Herbarium of the University of Bologna is a delightful green space that showcases an impressive collection of around 5,000 plants from all over the world. The garden has historical significance, having been frequented by renowned teachers such as Ulisse Aldrovandi. While the greenhouses are not open to visitors, they serve as valuable educational resources for university students. Visitors can enjoy the serene atmosphere, complete with a pond where frogs and lizards can be spotted.
name: Botanical Garden and Herbarium

detail_description: The Gelato Museum Carpigiani, located just a short ride from Piazza Maggiore in Bologna, is a unique attraction dedicated to the history and craft of artisan gelato. It's also home to the renowned Gelato University, offering courses for students and professionals on the art of making gelato since 2003. The museum takes visitors through the evolution of gelato over time, showcasing its cultural significance and technological advancements.
name: Gelato Museum Carpigiani
address: Via Emilia, 45, 40011 Anzola dell'Emilia BO, Italy

detail_description: The Two Towers, also known as Le due torri in Italian, are iconic landmarks in Bologna, Italy. These leaning towers, the Torre degli Asinelli and the Torre Garisenda, are symbols of the city and stand at the intersection of roads leading to the old ring wall gates. Dating back to the 12th century, they are among the few remaining from over a hundred original towers. The taller Asinelli Tower can be climbed and offers stunning views.
name: The Two Towers
address: Via Piero Gobetti, 52/3, 40129 Bologna BO, Italy

detail_description: Palazzo dei Notai is a historic palace located in the heart of Bologna's Main Square, Piazza Maggiore. It stands as a testament to the city's rich history and draws visitors from across Italy and beyond. Dating back to the 13th century, it underwent restoration in the early 20th century, preserving its medieval charm. The palace once served as the headquarters for the Society of Bolognese Notaries, reflecting its historical significance.
name: Palazzo dei Notai

detail_description: The Old Jewish Ghetto, also known as Ex Ghetto Ebraico, is located in the heart of Bologna's medieval center. This area is home to a variety of handicraft shops that showcase the city's artistic and cultural heritage. Among them are goldsmiths like the Andrea Sancini workshop, Casagrande Tigrino company, and Guizzardi jewelry shop.
name: Old Jewish Ghetto
address: Via Guglielmo Oberdan, 6, 40126 Bologna BO, Italy
